Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
basicallyt what happened is this:
create block is called
deamon is locked until block is created
during this process near teh end of create block the staking loop is called
the staking loop takes up to 10-25 even 30s to complete
dureing this time the deamon is locked
no RPC calls no block received nothing, locked.

what happens now
Create blcok is called
half way though the process the deamon lock is relaesed and the staking loop is called

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Fixed another long outstanding bug

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: When I asked james to put segid into getblock

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and it always returns -2

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: turns out the segid inside the block index is NEVER set

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I fixed that...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this also had the effect that the `getlastsegidstakes` RPC is now about 1000x faster

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Ity no longer has to fetch the entire block from disk but rather only iterate down the index. ğŸ˜

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I thaught this might be some hard forking change... but it does not appear to be the case... the code has a backup and actually every time it checks for segid, had to fully process the entire block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to calculate the segid for it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this should speed things up no end

Content: sync times are already faster ...
